content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word.

content.question: The father assuaged his baby's teething pain with some numbing drops.
The party’s convivial atmosphere put Jacob right at ease.
Jessie had her eclectic music collection to thank for landing her the DJ job.
Charities rely on munificent contributions from private citizens as well as endowments from corporations.
His mother was known in the neighborhood for her perspicacity when advising on difficult matters.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word.

content.question: There is something intrinsic to human biology that makes language possible for us, but not for chimpanzees.
Julian’s inveterate tardiness angered his boss.
The plant’s plentiful blooms were a propitious indication of Clare’s potential as a gardener.
Ringing cell phones were anathema to the theater’s patrons.
The ointment assuaged the inflammation on Tim’s skinned knee.

Mr. Caddell’s philistine attitude about the closing of the museum indicates that he is likely

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: The school board meeting did not get off to a propitious start. Mr. Henry, a business mogul known for his wildly popular fleet of food trucks, was running for an open position on the school board. He had hoped for support from the community but found himself facing a lot of opposition.

“You think a philistine who can't understand the intrinsic value of education?” an audience member yelled. Then, hands on her hips, “I am tired of businesspeople thinking they can come into our communities and run everything--even our schools--like a business,” she added, looking around the room before sitting down and letting out a frustrated breath.
Mr. Henry flexed his hand and said politely, “May I speak?” He then stood to face the woman and others sitting next to her.

“I understand your concerns." The avuncular businessperson said warmly, patting his teenage son's shoulder, "but I am just a parent like you, and I want my son and all our kids to get the best education possible.”

content.question: The meaning of propitious (line 1) is
In line 2, the phrase “business mogul” most nearly means
The word philistine (line 6) most nearly means
In line 5, intrinsic means
The meaning of avuncular (line 6) is
